XC1.inf_ex: Concrete inside buildings with low air humidity; Concrete permanently submerged in water

XC2.inf_ex: Concrete surfaces subject to long-term water contact; Many foundations

XC3.inf_ex: Concrete inside buildings with moderate or high air humidity; External concrete sheltered from rain

XC4.inf_ex: Concrete surfaces subject to water contact, not within exposure class XC2

XD1.inf_ex: Concrete surfaces exposed to airborne chlorides

XD2.inf_ex: Swimming pools; Concrete exposed to industrial waters containing chlorides

XD3.inf_ex: Parts of bridges exposed to spray containing chlorides. Pavements, Car park slabs

XS1.descr_env: Exposed to airborne salt but not in direct contact with sea water
XS1.inf_ex: Structures near to or on the coast

XF1.descr_env: Moderate water saturation, without de-icing agent
XF1.inf_ex: Vertical concrete surfaces exposed to rain and freezing

XF2.descr_env: Moderate water saturation, with de-icing agent
XF2.inf_ex: Vertical concrete surfaces of road structures exposed to freezing and airborne de-icing agents

XF3.descr_env: High water saturation, without de-icing agent
XF3.inf_ex: Horizontal concrete surfaces exposed to rain and freezing

XF4.descr_env: High water saturation, with de-icing agent or sea water
XF4.inf_ex: Road and bridge decks exposed to de-icing agents; Concrete surfaces exposed to direct spray containing de-icing agents and freezing; Splash zones of marine structures exposed to freezing
